Your password is not case sensitive and must be between 8 and 30 characters. It must include letters and numbers. As a good practice do not use the same password across different websites and refrain from using easy to guess information such as your name or date of birth.

Explanation of Risks for Listed Derviatives in Hong Kong and Overseas Markets is required. To proceed the order, please visit our HSBC Internet Banking website to place the order.

Please read The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited's ("we", "us", "our") "Notice relating to the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance", "Privacy and Security" and "Important Notes for HSBC Mobile Banking". If you would like to read them again after acceptance, you can visit "i" button which is located at the homepage of the HSBC Mobile Banking App ("App").


Important Notes for HSBC Mobile Banking 

HSBC Mobile Banking is part of HSBC Internet Banking service provided by us. All transactions conducted via the App is subject to the "Terms and Conditions for HSBC Internet Banking".

Due to the nature of the Internet, messages and transactions may be subject to interruption, transmission blackout, delayed transmission or incorrect data transmission. We are not liable for malfunctions in communications facilities beyond our control that may affect the accuracy or timeliness of messages and transactions you send.

HSBC Mobile Banking may carry additional risks. These include any loss or damage caused to your data or mobile device (including its setting), any interception, interruption or corruption in the transmission of instruction or messages, and any unauthorized use of password due to the auto-password-saving feature of certain mobile devices. We are not responsible for any of such risks. We are pleased to provide HSBC Mobile Banking service to you, but you have to accept these risks and all consequences arising from these risks.

Investment involves risk. The price of securities may move up or down. Losses may be incurred as well as profits made as a result of buying and selling securities.

We provide no advice or guidance on investment orders placed via HSBC Internet Banking. By placing investment orders via HSBC Internet Banking, you are deemed to acknowledge that (i) you have read and understood all relevant product literature and (ii) the order is made based on your own judgment without any advice from us.

Your risk tolerance level and the risk rating of a product are important information to help you assess whether the product is suitable for you. Please ensure that (i) you have completed your risk profiling questionnaire with us within the past 12 months and (ii) the risk rating of the product you intend to subscribe is at or below your risk tolerance level. A product with risk rating higher than your risk tolerance level may not be suitable for you. If you have any doubt about the suitability of a product, please contact us to obtain further information about the product before subscribing
Important Notes for HSBC Mobile Banking

We would like to store information in the App about how you use the App. This information does not identify you personally, but will make the App more relevant to you and will enable certain functionality. By clicking on the "Stored Information" button below, you can see details of the information that would be stored in the App.

We will store certain information on your device specific to you and your use of this app. The information is:
(i) Your log on preference.
(ii) Your default app setting preference.
You may continue to use this app even if you do not allow the above information to be stored. If you choose not to allow the information to be stored, any previously stored items will be deleted. 
Any information you do allow to be stored will only be stored on this device. It will not be sent back to HSBC and will not be shared with any third party.

Please read the Important Notes before you slide to send.\n\nOnce you have accepted the rate shown, this payment and rate will be confirmed. If this payment cannot be made, the rate will be cancelled. If there has been movement in exchange rates which leads to a loss or a gain, this will be passed on to your account. By accepting the rate you are agreeing to this. If you have checked all of your payment details and wish to accept the rate shown, please slide the “slide to send” bar to proceed.

Any cancellation after you proceed is subject to cost.

The rates displayed are indicative. If you do not instruct us to execute the transaction immediately by sliding to send, the time lag may result in a rate change and your transaction will be executed at the actual exchange rate at the time you instruct us to proceed.

Any conversion of foreign currency may result in gain or loss. In event any error occurs in the Bank’s systems or in any information provided hereunder due to market disruption, anomaly or event outside of the Bank’s control, the Bank reserves the right to rectify such error or take any action as appropriate on a case-by-case basis.

Please note that any transfer limit you may have set in Personal Internet Banking for transfers between your own account(s) will not be applied in this App.

This is the indicative foreign exchange rate HSBC will use to convert your money from the original currency into the selected currency. The HSBC exchange rate is based on the real time market level with a markup margin that represent HSBC\'s operation cost and reasonable profit to provide this service.

For HSBC to offer foreign exchange services to retail customers, the operation costs and a reasonable profit margin will be covered in the markup margin applied to the market FX rate. HSBC\'s markup margin is determined by a number of factors, including (but not limited to) the currency pairs, customer segments and transaction amount. In general, the markup margin will decrease as transaction amount increases.
In some situation, HSBC may levy a service fee for handling certain type of transaction. When a fee is levied, this will be reflected in the HSBC Current Rate for your ease of reference.

This is the rate we display in the trend charts. They represent the indicative level of exchange rates quoted between financial institutions in the global foreign exchange market to settle wholesale foreign exchange. The rates are provided by a third party data provider. The Market Rate will usually be different to HSBC Current Rate quoted for transactional purpose for our customers in the same moment. The former rate does not include HSBC\'s markup margin which has been applied to the latter.

The Target FX Rate feature allows customer to set a currency to be converted to another currency at specified rate, when the specified rate corresponds to the HSBC Rate (inclusive of markup margin). When the market condition reaches a level for your order to be executed, the system will automatically convert the original currency to your chosen currency. You will receive the exact amount of the chosen currency corresponding to the Target FX Rate that you have selected.

This is the indicative level of Market Rate at which HSBC will execute your limit order at the Target FX Rate you have selected. The Reference Watch Rate is calculated by removing the Markup Margin from your Target FX Rate. It is provided as a comparison against the Interbank Market Level. However, please note that market FX rate quoted by third party news agency are indicative, and may not match the exact level used by HSBC in the Interbank market. Therefore, we do not guarantee that your limit order will be executed when your Reference Watch Rate has been matched against the third party data source.
Please select how you\'d like to be notified if your Client Target Conversion Rate is reached.

Any cancellation is subject to cost.

The rates are indicative and will only be executed as the actual exchange rate when the rate is accepted before the rate is lapsed.

Your phone number and email address are required for sending notification to third-party payment beneficiaries. If you do not verify your contact, you may not be able to access payment functions. If you would like to update your contact details, please go HSBC online banking.
Not the right contact details? Please contact HSBC to update.
Your home currency will be used as the default for any currency related in %1$s.
Why I Can\'t find my contact?

HSBC requires your contact details so we can notify you when your transactions are complete.

 1. Global transfers – Used to notify forward-dated transactions

 2. Set rate order – Used to notify when order is fulfilled or expired

 3. Price alert – Used to notify when rate hits alert threshold

 4. Cross border wires – SMS sent to valid mobile number. E-mail not used for notifications. If none on record, we will send a paper advice

How to Manage My Quick FX

Tap and hold on any of the tiles to access Quick FX edit mode from which you can easily add maximum six recent activities to favourites by tapping the \"+\" button on the tiles. If you already have six favourites, you\'ll have to first remove one by tapping \"x\" button before adding new favourites.
Tap on burger menu and go to transaction history, then tap on \"Star\" icon to star particular transaction as favourites to Quick Fx.
